questions.question: Choose the correct statement that describes Stroop Effect.

answers.a: Is a phenomenon in which the tendency to name a word will interfere with the ability to say the color in which the word is printed.
answers.b: Is a mental activity that consists of organizing information or beliefs into a series of steps in order to reach conclusions.
answers.c: Is a phenomenon in which the patient loses the ability to learn new things after a head injury.
answers.d: Is a phenomenon in which participants fail to detect the change in a scene when the change matches the context.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of Stroop Effect?

You are standing at a T junction and looking for a direction signage board to find the location of building X. Though unknown to you, the actual location of the building is to your right. You happen to find a signage as follows. Which of the following direction board will help in making decision faster and more accurate?
What does the Stroop effect demonstrate?

answers.a: The impact of font styles on reading speed.
answers.b: The influence of word length on memory recall.
answers.c: The interference between automatic word reading and color identification.
answers.d: The relationship between word complexity and reading comprehension.
